title: Omar Torri
text:
Omar Torri (born 30 March 1982 in <a href="Trescore%20Balneario">Trescore Balneario</a>) is an Italian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. Currently, he plays for <a href="A.C.%20Monza%20Brianza%201912">Monza</a>.
Football career.
On 3 July 2007, he was signed by Serie B side <a href="U.C.%20AlbinoLeffe">AlbinoLeffe</a> in 3-year contract from Serie D side <a href="U.S.%20Calcio%20Caravaggese">USO Calcio</a>. In the first season, he wrote no.8 shirt.
On 30 January 2008, he was loaned to Serie C2 side <a href="A.C.%20Pavia">Pavia</a>. On 29 August 2008 he left for <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Lega Pro Prima Divisione</a> side <a href="A.C.%20Monza%20Brianza%201912">Monza</a>.
Since the departure of <a href="Francesco%20Ruopolo">Francesco Ruopolo</a> and <a href="Marco%20Cellini">Marco Cellini</a>, Torri had more chance to play. At the opening match of 2010-11 season, Torri partnered with <a href="Leandro%20Antonio%20Mart%C3%ADnez">Leandro Antonio Martínez</a> and <a href="Karamoko%20Ciss%C3%A9">Karamoko Cissé</a>, which Torri scored twice and Cissé scored once, helped AlbinoLeffe beat fellow Serie B club <a href="Delfino%20Pescara%201936">Pescara</a> 3–1 in <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a>.
On 2 September 2010, he signed a new 4-year contract with <a href="U.C.%20AlbinoLeffe">AlbinoLeffe</a>.
On 21 August 2012, he joined <a href="A.C.%20Lumezzane">Lumezzane</a> on loan. But in January 2013, he left for <a href="A.C.%20Cuneo%201905">Cuneo</a>.
On 29 January 2014, goes to the <a href="Real%20Vicenza%20V.S.">Real Vicenza</a>.
On 29 July 2014, goes to the <a href="A.S.%20Pro%20Piacenza%201919">Pro Piacenza</a>.
On 14 January 2015, returns after six years at <a href="A.C.%20Monza%20Brianza%201912">Monza</a>
